intro: Guatteria persicifolia, commonly known as the roseleaf guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central America and the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its dense, glossy, elliptical leaves that resemble rose leaves, hence its common name. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by yellowish-orange berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
